storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the dashboard menu

steps.action: Click on next day navigation button twice

steps.action: Verify responsive layout on mobile device or resize browser window to mobile dimensions

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive confirmation that my schedule is loaded successfully to ensure data accuracy

Employee has schedule data available in the system
System backend is operational and accessible
Employee is logged into the application

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section begins to load

steps.action: Check if the error message provides actionable guidance (e.g., retry button, contact support)
steps.expectedResult: Error message includes helpful information or options for the employee to resolve the issue

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to access my schedule securely to protect my personal and work information

steps.expectedResult: Browser navigates to the entered URL

steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthenticated access and immediately redirects to the login page

steps.action: Enter valid employee username in the username field

steps.expectedResult: Password is masked and accepted in the field

steps.action: Click the 'Login' or 'Sign In' button to submit credentials
steps.expectedResult: System validates credentials and authenticates the employee

steps.action: Verify successful authentication and redirection
steps.expectedResult: Employee is redirected to their schedule page showing their personal schedule data

steps.action: Verify only the authenticated employee's schedule is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Schedule shows only shifts and information belonging to the logged-in employee, no other employee data is visible

steps.action: Check the browser address bar for the schedule URL
steps.expectedResult: URL shows the schedule page path with secure HTTPS protocol

steps.action: Verify authentication session is established by checking for session indicators
steps.expectedResult: User profile or name is displayed, logout option is available, session is active

postconditions: Employee is successfully authenticated and logged in
Employee has access to their own schedule only
Secure session is established
Authentication cookies are set
User can navigate within the application
No unauthorized data is accessible

testCases.title: Test session timeout after inactivity
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Session timeout is configured to 15 minutes of inactivity
Employee is not currently logged in
System clock is accurate
No automated scripts or background processes will interact with the application
Timer or clock is available to track 15-minute period

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with authentication form

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted in the form fields

steps.action: Click the 'Login' button to authenticate
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to their schedule page

steps.action: Verify successful login by confirming schedule data is visible
steps.expectedResult: Employee's schedule is displayed with all shifts and details visible

steps.action: Note the current time and begin the inactivity period - do not interact with the application in any way (no mouse movements, clicks, or keyboard input)
steps.expectedResult: Application remains displayed but receives no user input

steps.action: Wait for exactly 15 minutes without any interaction with the browser or application
steps.expectedResult: Time passes with no user activity detected by the system

steps.action: After 15 minutes have elapsed, attempt to interact with the application by clicking on any schedule element or navigation control
steps.expectedResult: System detects session timeout and either immediately logs out the user or displays a session expired message

steps.action: Verify the user is logged out and redirected to the login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed, schedule data is no longer accessible, session is terminated

steps.action: Verify a session timeout message or notification is displayed
steps.expectedResult: User sees a clear message indicating the session expired due to inactivity (e.g., 'Your session has expired. Please log in again.')

steps.action: Attempt to use browser back button to return to schedule page
steps.expectedResult: System prevents access and redirects back to login page, no cached schedule data is displayed

steps.action: Verify authentication cookies have been cleared
steps.expectedResult: Session cookies are removed from browser, no valid session exists

postconditions: Employee session is terminated
Employee is logged out of the application
Schedule data is no longer accessible
Authentication cookies are cleared
User must re-authenticate to access schedule
No security vulnerabilities are exposed

testCases.title: Verify HTTPS enforcement
preconditions: Application is deployed with HTTPS configured
SSL/TLS certificates are valid and properly installed
HTTP to HTTPS redirect is configured on the server
Employee account exists in the system
Browser supports both HTTP and HTTPS protocols
DNS is properly configured for the application domain

steps.action: Open a new browser window or tab
steps.expectedResult: New browser session is ready

steps.action: In the address bar, type the application schedule URL using HTTP protocol explicitly (e.g., http://app.example.com/schedule)
steps.expectedResult: HTTP URL is entered in the address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to attempt accessing the schedule page over HTTP
steps.expectedResult: Browser sends HTTP request to the server

steps.action: Observe the browser address bar during and after the page load
steps.expectedResult: Connection is automatically redirected from HTTP to HTTPS, address bar shows 'https://' protocol

steps.action: Verify the secure connection indicator is displayed in the browser
steps.expectedResult: Browser displays a padlock icon or 'Secure' indicator next to the URL, confirming HTTPS connection

steps.action: Click on the padlock icon to view certificate information
steps.expectedResult: SSL/TLS certificate details are displayed showing valid certificate issued to the correct domain

steps.action: Verify the final URL in the address bar uses HTTPS protocol
steps.expectedResult: URL displays as 'https://app.example.com/schedule' or similar with HTTPS protocol

steps.action: Check that the redirect happened automatically without user intervention
steps.expectedResult: Redirect was seamless and automatic, no manual action was required from the user

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Network tab shows the HTTP request received a 301 or 302 redirect response to HTTPS

steps.action: Attempt to access other application pages using HTTP protocol (e.g., http://app.example.com/login)
steps.expectedResult: All pages automatically redirect to HTTPS, no page is accessible over unsecured HTTP

steps.action: Verify no mixed content warnings appear in the browser console
steps.expectedResult: All resources (images, scripts, stylesheets) are loaded over HTTPS, no security warnings are displayed

postconditions: All connections to the application use HTTPS protocol
SSL/TLS encryption is active for all data transmission
No insecure HTTP connections are allowed
Security indicators are properly displayed in browser
Application is accessible only through secure protocol
User data is protected during transmission
